channel.title: I recieved my first Axoloti yesterday and i'm having lots of problems on OSX 10.11.6 El Capitan
channel.description:
USB device found connected Authentic Axoloti Core Firmware version: 1.0.0.1, crc=0xE95BAC96, entrypoint=0x20011000 Firmware CRC mismatch! Please flash the firmware first! Hardware firmware CRC = E95BAC96 <> Software CRC = Please compile the firmware first
Link to firmware CRC Please compile the firmware first can't read flasher, please compile firmware! (file: /Applications/axoloti_runtime/flasher/flasher_build/flasher.bin )

item.title: I recieved my first Axoloti yesterday and i'm having lots of problems on OSX 10.11.6 El Capitan
item.dc:creator: @thetechnobear Mark Harris
item.description:
@thetechnobear wrote:

ok, those defaults are not what the application produces...

quit Axoloti, and delete ~/Documents/axolot/axoloti.prefs, then restart axoloti , it will return the defaults to the correct settings.

generally, you do not need to alter these settings , the defaults created by axoloti are fine.

Read full topic
item.source: I recieved my first Axoloti yesterday and i'm having lots of problems on OSX 10.11.6 El Capitan

item.title: I recieved my first Axoloti yesterday and i'm having lots of problems on OSX 10.11.6 El Capitan
item.dc:creator: @Chindogu chindogu.visual@gmail.com
item.description:
@Chindogu wrote:

The problem is that in the Axoloti interfase is not possible to access to Axoloti.app directory

Screen Shot 2018-02-21 at 10.14.53 AM.png1143x275 52.5 KB

It not figure as a folder and you couldn't write the root

Read full topic
item.source: I recieved my first Axoloti yesterday and i'm having lots of problems on OSX 10.11.6 El Capitan

item.title: I recieved my first Axoloti yesterday and i'm having lots of problems on OSX 10.11.6 El Capitan
item.dc:creator: @thetechnobear Mark Harris
item.description:
@thetechnobear wrote:

yeah, and specifically check that you put Axoloti.app and axoloti_runtime both into /Applications

in Axoloti file->preferences the directories should look like

Screen Shot 2018-02-21 at 13.23.27.png877x158 11.8 KB

if they dont, then you will either need to select them correctly or delete axoloti.prefs in ~/Documents/axoloti

Chindogu:

Link to firmware CRC Please compile the firmware first
can't read flasher, please compile firmware! (file: /Applications/axoloti_runtime/flasher/flasher_build/flasher.bin )

this error indicates the firmware directory is incorrectly pointing to the wrong place, which is why I think things were not put in the correct directory, so it detected it wrong.
which may need axoloti.prefs deleted , once the app is in the right place, so it can fix this setting

Read full topic
item.source: I recieved my first Axoloti yesterday and i'm having lots of problems on OSX 10.11.6 El Capitan

item.title: I recieved my first Axoloti yesterday and i'm having lots of problems on OSX 10.11.6 El Capitan
item.dc:creator: @lokki
item.description:
@lokki wrote:

have you installed both, application bundle and axoloti_runtime?

see here:

Installing on Mac OS X User Guide
Normal Installation To reduce size we split the application into two parts, the main axoloti application, and a runtime which contains other required files. You must download and install both initially. (Usually updates will only require the main application to be downloaded and installed.) download both application bundle and axoloti_runtime go to http://github.com/axoloti/axoloti/releases, you will see the 'latest release' download axo_runtime_osx_(version).dmg download axoloti_osx_(versâ€¦

Read full topic
